title: Root of unity modulo n
summary: In number theory, a kth root of unity modulo n for positive integers k, n ≥ 2,  is a root of unity in the ring of integers modulo n; that is, a solution x to the equation (or congruence) x k ≡ 1 ( mod n ) {\displaystyle x^{k}\equiv 1{\pmod {n}}} .  If k is the smallest such exponent for x, then x is called a primitive kth root of unity modulo n.[1] See modular arithmetic for notation and terminology.
